tier_1_determinative.five_or_more_persons_committing_dacoity: The case involves four accused, which does not meet the requirement of five or more persons for dacoity under IPC 395. However, the application for bail was considered for accused numbers 2 and 3.

tier_2_material.property_stolen: Jewellery was stolen from the house of the informant, Navnath Haridas Metkari.

tier_3_contextual.incident_location: The incident occurred at the house of Navnath Haridas Metkari, in Baramati, Lokhandevasti, Katphal, District Pune.
tier_3_contextual.incident_date_time: The FIR was registered on 04/05/2023, indicating the incident occurred around this time.

tier_4_procedural.case_title: Adesh Anil Kale & Umesh Anil Kale vs. The State of Maharashtra
tier_4_procedural.court_name: High Court of Judicature at Bombay
tier_4_procedural.appellant_or_petitioner: Adesh Anil Kale and Umesh Anil Kale
tier_4_procedural.counsel_for_appellant: Ms. Poonam Patil i/b Mr. Manindra Pandey
tier_4_procedural.counsel_for_respondent: Ms. Rutuja Ambekar, APP for the State
tier_4_procedural.acts_and_sections: Indian Penal Code, 1860 - Sections 395, 452, 457, 380, 506 read with 34

residual_details.additional_facts: The applicants, aged 19, are brothers with no prior criminal antecedents. The charge sheet has been filed, and there was a recovery of gold ornaments at their instance. One accused remains absconding.
